org.ipdr.protocol
Class ProtocolStreamMsg

java.lang.Object
  org.ipdr.protocol.ProtocolMsg
      org.ipdr.protocol.ProtocolStreamMsg
All Implemented Interfaces:
ProtocolMsgIdentification
Direct Known Subclasses:
ProtocolMsgCONNECT, ProtocolMsgCONNECT_RESPONSE, ProtocolMsgDATA, ProtocolMsgDATA_ACK, ProtocolMsgEmpty, ProtocolMsgERROR, ProtocolMsgFLOW_STOP, ProtocolMsgGET_SESSIONS, ProtocolMsgGET_SESSIONS_RESPONSE, ProtocolMsgGET_TEMPLATES, ProtocolMsgGET_TEMPLATES_RESPONSE, ProtocolMsgHeaderOnly, ProtocolMsgSESSION_START, ProtocolMsgSESSION_STOP, ProtocolMsgTemplate
public abstract class ProtocolStreamMsg
extends ProtocolMsg

The Java encapsulation of a IPDR protocol message over TCP The message has the common header:

struct IPDRStreamingHeader { char version; // version of protocol, for this version, set to 2 char messageId; // the ID of this Message (see MessageIds) char sessionId; // the ID of this Session or 0 if not Session-specific char messageFlags; // reserved/unused and set to 0 int messageLen; // length in bytes of Message including header }

protocolVersion

public short protocolVersion

sessionId

public byte sessionId
The session identifier

hdrFlags

public byte hdrFlags
Message header flags (ignored in version 1 and 2 of the protocol)

msgLength

public int msgLength
Message length, from the header. The header shows an unsigned 32 but Java won't let us construct a byte array with a "long", so let's leave this as an "int" (2^31 is a pretty big message in CRANE anyway!).

public static final int HDR_LENGTH

verifyLength

protected static final void verifyLength(ProtocolMsgIdentification id,
                                         byte[] buf,
                                         int bufLength,
                                         int requiredLength)
                                  throws ProtocolMalformedMsgException
Verify the length and throw an exception if wrong

Parameters:
id - the object that provides identification methods (may be null)
buf - the raw message buffer
bufLength - the message buffer length
requiredLength - the minimum size of the message
Throws:
ProtocolMalformedMsgException - if bufLength < requiredLength

round32

public static final int round32(int value)
Round the length to 4-byte alignment

Parameters:
value - length
Returns:
rounded length

trimToLength

protected final byte[] trimToLength(byte[] buf,
                                    int length)
Trim a byte vector to a particular length. This is a slightly inefficient routine, mainly for catching errors: it may reallocate the vector in the course of trimming.

Parameters:
buf - The input vector
length - The length to trim it to
Returns:
The original vector, if it was already of that length; an exception if the length is too long; otherwise a new vector of the exact length (with the contents of the input vector).

msgId

public abstract byte msgId()
Get the message id value. This is overridden by a subclass.

shouldOutputToLog

public boolean shouldOutputToLog()
Flag for whether we should we output a log message when sending or receiving. Subclasses may override this (i.e., DATA and DATA_ACK) will to check for "debug" level output.

readMsg

public static final ProtocolStreamMsg readMsg(byte[] buf,
                                              ConnectionDynamic connection,
                                              java.lang.String whatDoing,
                                              ProtocolStreamMsg responseTo,
                                              int timeoutMillisec)
                                       throws ConnectionIOException,
                                              ProtocolMalformedMsgException
Read a message from input. This allocates a buffer each time, so it is less efficient than using

Parameters:
whatDoing - A brief description of what this read is for; used to construct a meaningful exception (may be NULL)
responseTo - The message to which this is a response (may be NULL)
timeoutMillisec - zero for infinite wait
Returns:
The internal form of the message
Throws:
ConnectionIOException
ProtocolMalformedMsgException

construct

public static final ProtocolStreamMsg construct(byte[] msg,
                                                int length,
                                                ProtocolMsgDATA msgDATA)
                                         throws ProtocolMalformedMsgException
Factory method for constructing from raw bytes. This looks into the header and calls the appropriate sub-class

Parameters:
msg - the raw bytes
length - the number of bytes in the message
msgDATA - a pre-allocated DATA object, which can be used if if this is of that type -- null if you want one constructed.
Returns:
the Java-ized form of the message
Throws:
ProtocolMalformedMsgException
